EmailTemplate.subject: Thank you for your interest in Global Technology and Entrepreneurship
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
{!Contact.FirstName},
Thank you for your interest in the Master of Technology in global technology and entrepreneurship. Through this program, you will become well prepared for entrepreneurial roles in global technology driven organizations. You will gain the ability to develop and manage innovation; lean, complex systems and strategy projects, and you will gain a unique perspective on addressing global competitive challenges in industries such as manufacturing, supply chain, health care, defense, transportation and more.
In this program, you will explore a number of topic areas such as:
-development, management and execution of lean process projects -analysis and modeling of complex systems -global strategy -analysis of complex decision problems -entrepreneurial decision making -open innovation -project management
The Master of Technology program requires 33 credit hours and an applied project. See course samples.
Admission Information
Consideration is given to students who have an appropriate technical, science or business baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and who possess course work in statistics and technical writing. Applicants must also submit a GRE score, and international applicants must meet university TOEFL standards. The applicantâ€™s past work and professional experience are also evaluated and taken into consideration. Industrial experience beyond completion of a baccalaureate degree is strongly recommended. See details on application requirements, documents required, and timelines.
I hope this information proves useful to you as you consider degree programs. If you are ready to apply, I encourage you to start your application today.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Ash
Student Recruitment Coordinator
College of Technology and Innovation
